text:
When I configure my server and put certificates and do all possible config, I obtain ALWAYS this message :

ofcorse :
mod ssl is enabled (a2enmod ssl)
ports ans virtuals hosts are OK!!

server:~# apache2ctl start
[Tue Feb 21 15:36:08 2012] [warn] module ssl_module is already loaded, skipping
Syntax error on line 1 of /etc/apache2/conf.d/certs/certificate.PEM:
Invalid command '-----BEGIN', perhaps misspelled or defined by a module not included in the server configuration

And apache d'ont start!!!

I d'ont know where is the probleme??!! help plz
creator: wissem.saied@hotmail.com
covener@gmail.com
text:
You put your certificate in a path where it's picked by the Include directive.  Usually a wildcard include should be limited to e.g. *.conf which would have not picked up your *.PEM.

http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/core.html#include

creator: wissem.saied@hotmail.com
text:
I dont talk about the warining!! I add this line to be sure that SSl module is enabled. 
And in my  hddpd.conf I have add this line :
Include /etc/apache2/conf.d/certs/certificate.PEM

==> I have this error :

server:~# apache2ctl start
Syntax error on line 1 of /etc/apache2/conf.d/certs/S913_SRTGN_01_12.PEM:
Invalid command '-----BEGIN', perhaps misspelled or defined by a module not included in the server configuration


Thanks

creator: wissem.saied@hotmail.com
text:
==> I have this error :

server:~# apache2ctl start
Syntax error on line 1 of /etc/apache2/conf.d/certs/certificate.PEM:
Invalid command '-----BEGIN', perhaps misspelled or defined by a module not
included in the server configuration

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text:
Have a look at the SSL configuration HowTo at http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/ssl/ssl_howto.html

You don't Include your certificate file, you use SSLCertificateFile to load it.

Hope this helps.
